name: nanoseq-rna-isoform-detection
title: Nanoseq RNA Isoform Detection: Full-Length Transcript Analysis
description: Oxford Nanopore direct RNA sequencing pipeline for detecting full-length transcript isoforms, alternative splicing events, and RNA modifications. Ideal for transcriptomics researchers studying isoform diversity, splice variants, and gene expression without assembly artifacts.
content:
ğŸ§¬ Nanoseq RNA Isoform Detection: Full-Length Transcript Analysis

Discover Complete Transcript Isoforms with Long-Read RNA Sequencing

Oxford Nanopore direct RNA sequencing provides full-length transcript reads without fragmentation or assembly, enabling accurate detection of splice isoforms, gene fusions, and RNA modifications that short-read sequencing cannot resolve.

ğŸ¯ Why Long-Read RNA-Seq?

ğŸ”¬ Full-Length Transcripts

  • ğŸ¯ No assembly required: Direct sequencing of complete transcripts from 5' to 3'

  • ğŸ§© Resolve complex isoforms: Accurately identify all exon combinations and splice junctions

  • ğŸ“Š True isoform quantification: Count full-length isoforms without computational inference

  • âœ… Best for: Alternative splicing studies, fusion detection, novel isoform discovery

âš¡ Direct RNA Advantages

  • ğŸ§¬ Native RNA sequencing: No reverse transcription or amplification bias

  • ğŸ” RNA modifications: Detect m6A, pseudouridine, and other modifications

  • ğŸ“ Poly(A) tail length: Measure poly(A) tail lengths directly

  • ğŸ¯ Strand-specific: Inherently strand-specific sequencing

ğŸ§ª Analysis Modes

ğŸ“Š Isoform Detection Tools

Choose the optimal transcript reconstruction approach:

  • ğŸ§¬ Bambu - Recommended for comprehensive isoform discovery

    • Context-aware transcript reconstruction

    • Novel isoform detection with high precision

    • Integrated quantification of known and novel transcripts

    • Best for: Discovery-focused experiments

  • ğŸ”¬ StringTie2 - Reference-guided assembly

    • Accurate transcript assembly and quantification

    • Handles multi-sample experiments efficiently

    • Outputs GTF files for downstream analysis

    • Best for: Known isoform quantification

ğŸ§¬ RNA Modification Detection

  • m6anet: N6-methyladenosine (m6A) modification detection

  • xpore: Differential RNA modification analysis across conditions

  • Applications: Epitranscriptomics, RNA regulation, disease mechanisms

ğŸ”— RNA Fusion Detection

  • JAFFAL: Sensitive fusion transcript detection

  • No assembly artifacts: Fusions detected from full-length reads

  • Applications: Cancer genomics, oncogene discovery

ğŸ“‹ Input Data Formats

The pipeline accepts multiple input formats:

  • FASTQ files: Pre-basecalled Nanopore reads (most common)

  • FAST5 files: Raw signal data for basecalling with Guppy/Dorado

  • BAM files: Pre-aligned reads for downstream analysis only

ğŸ“Š Sample Sheet Format

Your CSV samplesheet defines the experiment structure:

sample,fastq,barcode
control_rep1,control_1.fastq.gz,
control_rep2,control_2.fastq.gz,
treated_rep1,treated_1.fastq.gz,
treated_rep2,treated_2.fastq.gz,

ğŸ§¬ Reference Genome Selection

Choose from comprehensive reference genomes:

  • ğŸ§‘ Human: GRCh37, GRCh38, CHM13 - optimized for human transcriptome studies

  • ğŸ­ Model Organisms: Mouse (GRCm38, GRCm39), zebrafish, fly

  • ğŸŒ± Plants: Arabidopsis, rice, maize - plant transcriptomics

  • ğŸ¦  Microbes: Yeast, bacteria - microbial transcriptome profiling

All genomes include comprehensive gene annotations for accurate isoform identification.

ğŸ“Š Comprehensive Results

Transcript Isoform Data

  • ğŸ“Š Isoform Counts: Transcript-level expression matrices

  • ğŸ§¬ Novel Isoforms: Newly discovered splice variants with annotations

  • ğŸ”— Fusion Transcripts: Gene fusion events with breakpoint details

  • ğŸ“ Transcript Structures: GTF/GFF files of reconstructed transcripts

RNA Modifications

  • ğŸ§ª Modification Sites: Positions and confidence scores

  • ğŸ“Š Differential Modifications: Condition-specific modification patterns

  • ğŸ¯ Functional Context: Modifications mapped to transcript features

Quality Control

  • ğŸ“ˆ Read Statistics: Length distribution, quality scores, throughput

  • ğŸ¯ Alignment Metrics: Mapping rates, coverage uniformity

  • ğŸ“Š MultiQC Report: Comprehensive analysis summary with interactive plots

Differential Analysis

  • ğŸ§® DESeq2: Differential gene expression analysis

  • ğŸ§¬ DEXSeq: Differential exon usage and isoform switching

  • ğŸ“Š Visualization: Volcano plots, MA plots, isoform switch graphs

ğŸ”¬ Scientific Applications

Perfect for Research in:

  • ğŸ§¬ Alternative Splicing: Tissue-specific and disease-associated splice variants

  • ğŸ¯ Isoform Diversity: Complete isoform catalogs without assembly bias

  • ğŸ”¬ Epitranscriptomics: m6A and other RNA modifications

  • ğŸ§ª Cancer Genomics: Fusion transcript detection and characterization

  • ğŸŒ± Plant Biology: Complex plant transcriptomes with polyploidy

  • ğŸ§  Neuroscience: Neuronal isoform diversity and complexity

  • ğŸ’Š Drug Discovery: Target isoform identification and validation

ğŸ“– Test Data Available

The pipeline includes built-in test profiles using:

  • Data Source: Singapore Nanopore Expression Consortium (SG-NEx)

  • Cell Lines: Cancer cell lines (HepG2, K562, MCF7, A549, Hct116)

  • Protocol: Direct cDNA and native RNA sequencing

  • Test Command: Use -profile test for rapid validation
